title: Big Chief - Face@320
description:
\"Fresh Vines\" doesn\&#039;t merely resemble Black Sabbath, because it is Black Sabbath. Within the first minute, you hear segments of that band\&#039;s \"War Pigs\" and \"After Forever.\" Any band with the cajones to directly lift two songs from Birmingham\&#039;s finest in the opening song of its first LP deserves some credit. Either that or they\&#039;re asking for trouble. What the hell, you know? Hip-hop has its share of direct samples, so why not rock & roll? Big Chief is actually playing it, and if you\&#039;re gonna steal, you might as well steal from the best.
Face cleans up the sound from the early singles. The rhythm section of bassist Matt O\&#039;Brien and drummer Mike Danner is given more room to breathe, as everything comes across as more pliable, less cluttered. Just as importantly, Barry Henssler transforms from a vocalist to a singer -- his increased range no longer pins the band into a corner. The record seems to stick to two gears, toggling between charging and deliberate. With some furious soloing, \"Drive It Off\" introduces overt bluesiness into the band\&#039;s repertoire, while the stomping \"Desert Jam\" matches the molasses-paced lurchers of early Soundgarden and Jane\&#039;s Addiction.



                            
01. Drive It Off                                                                                                        
02. Now Who Gonna Do All That                                                                                           
03. Lie There And Be Good                                                                                               
04. Reduced To Tears                                                                                                    
05. Bong Wrench                                                                                                         
06. 500 Reasons                                                                                                         
07. Fresh Vines                                                                                                         
08. Desert Jam                                                                                                          
09. Face                                                                                                                
10. Honey-Legged                                                                                                        
11. Damnit, Somebody Give Me A Beer!
